analysis.description:
ProfitContainerAdapter.takeEtherProfits (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#466-471) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- assert(profitContainerLocation.call.value(this.balance)()) (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#470)
ValueTrader.die (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#184-187) allows anyone to destruct the contract

ValueTrader.verifiedTransferFrom (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#322-327) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- assert((safeSub(balanceAfter,balanceBefore) == amount))

Reentrancy in ValueTrader.buyEther (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#300-305):
	External calls:
	- assert(valueToToken(etherContract,balances[msg.sender]) >= amount) (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#301)

	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balances (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#302)

Reentrancy in ValueTrader.buyToken (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#288-293):

	- assert(destroyValue(msg.sender,tokenToValue(token,amount))) (/../data/reentrancy/solidity_contract/39817.sol#290)
	State variables written after the call(s):
